data.title: Beatlecracker Suite Pack
data.text:
LENNON, John (1940-1980) + McCARTNEY, Paul (1942- ) + TCHAIKOVSKY, Pyotr Ilych (1840-1893)

BEATLECRACKER SUITE (arr.Arthur Wilkinson)

Concert Originals Series GMCO049

Catalogue Number: GMCO049

Difficulty level: E What's this?

ISMN: 9790222235960

View Score

Play Audio

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio. Here is a link to the audio instead.

DIGITAL DOWNLOAD

As an alternative to having a lovely printed copy sent to you, for this title you can buy it as a DIGITAL DOWNLOAD which you can print out yourself. This is in the form of a PDF file which you will be able to download to your computer or device immediately after purchase together with a licence authorising the use of the file for one copy only. You will have 14 days to download the file, after which it will no longer be accessible to you online. Should you need more than one copy (such as for a choir or orchestra) then you must purchase as many "copies" as you need; you will still only have one file to download but the licence will authorise the number of copies purchased. If you buy multiple copies you are allowed to print only up to that number of copies. Alternatively, you can share the file electronically instead; but the total number of prints and shared electronic copies must not exceed the number purchased.

Level of Difficulty

Attributing a particular level of difficulty to an orchestral piece is awkward!

A piece may be easy for the strings but difficult for the brass; it may feature a tricky instrumental solo but the other parts may be relatively straight forward. A number of the arrangements listed are designed to simplify works to some extent but composers of many original works featured did not consider difficulty when writing them. What our levels mean:

A = for players up to UK Grade 3

B = Grade 3 to 5

C = Grade 4 to 6

D = Grade 5 to 7

E = Grade 6 to 8

F = Grade 7 and over

Our gradings should be taken only as a rough guide.

To be sure if a piece is suitable for you, take a look at the score.

Orchestration

3 Flutes (3rd db.piccolo), 2 Oboes (2nd db.Cor Anglais), 2 Clarinets (2nd db.Bass Clarinet), 2 Bassoons

4 Horns in F, 2 Trumpets in Bb, 3 Trombones, Tuba, Timpani, Percussion (Triangle, Side Drum, Bass Drum, Cymbals, Suspended Cymbal, Finger Cymbals, Glockenspiel, Tambourine), Harp, Celeste db.Piano

Strings (Violin 1, Violin 2, Viola, Cello, Bass)

In the mid 1960s, the late Roy Castle had a series of variety shows on BBC Television and Arthur Wilkinson (1924-1968) was his musical director. On one of the shows, the celebrity guest was ballet star Doreen Wells who asked if she could dance to music of the Beatles. It fell to Arthur Wilkinson to arrange Lennon/McCartney for use by a ballerina. He hit on the idea of using part of Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker Suite as a model; it was so popular that further movements were added for an EP recording and the complete Beatlecracker Suite is the result. All eight movements of the original Nutcracker Suite are here albeit with themes by Lennon and McCartney - just imagine the Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy to Can't buy me love . . . . .

The movements are:

1. Miniature Overture (Help!)

2. March (When I'm 64)

3. Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy (Can't buy me love)

4. Arabian Dance (It's for you)

5. Chinese Dance (Ticket to ride)

6. Dance of the Reed Flutes (She loves you)

7. Waltz of the Flowers (From me to you)

8. Pas de Deux (All my loving)

This Suite was prepared by Gavin Sutherland for a recent CD recording which is available on an ASV CD entitled "British by Arrangement" played by the City of Prague Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Gavin.

Duration: 14 minutes

Not for sale in USA or Asia

A PACK comprises one full score, string parts 4/4/3/4/2 and all wind, brass and percussion parts.
